creator: dbrosius@apache.org
text:
This patch represents some simple code cleanups. Not critical, but good ideas 
none the less.

creator: kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com
text:
Do you have any tests for this patch?  I think one of teh changes affects
behaviour (logic) rather than simple cleanup.

For the + -> append changes (using StringBuffer), these are trivial and can be
merged in as they only affect the memory consumption of the app (reducing it). 
If you could provide tests I'd be happier with the other changes.

Thanks
Kev

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: Which change appeared to affect logic, Kev?  I apparently didn't catch it...

creator: kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com
jkf@apache.org
text:
I am applying this patch,

except for the marking public inner classes as static, this would be a non
backward compatible change (existing compiled tasks external to ant would break)
But I am marking another private inner class static

The PathConvert.java has an explicit note about using != instead of ! equals so
I didn't lift that one either.

And finally I didn't apply the chained .append parts, but unchained them instead.
